title: CS101: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Fundamental concepts of computer science including algorithms, data structures, and problem-solving. Required course for all computer science students.

syllabus.title: Introduction to React Fundamentals
syllabus.description: Understanding React components, JSX, and basic concepts

syllabus.title: Advanced React Patterns
syllabus.description: Context API, render props, and compound components

syllabus.title: Testing React Applications
syllabus.description: Unit testing, integration testing, and testing best practices

lectures.title: What is React?
lectures.description: Introduction to React and its ecosystem

lectures.title: Setting Up Your Development Environment
lectures.description: Installing Node.js, npm, and creating your first React app

lectures.title: JSX and Components
lectures.description: Understanding JSX syntax and component structure

lectures.title: Props and State
lectures.description: Passing data between components and managing local state

assignments.title: Build Your First React Component
assignments.description: Create a simple counter component using React hooks
assignments.instructions: Create a React component that displays a counter with increment and decrement buttons. Use useState hook to manage the counter state.
assignments.feedback: Excellent work! Your component structure is clean and follows React best practices.

assignments.title: React Fundamentals Quiz
assignments.description: Test your knowledge of React core concepts
assignments.instructions: Complete the online quiz covering JSX, components, props, and state.

assignments.title: Personal Portfolio Project
assignments.description: Build a personal portfolio website using React
assignments.instructions: Create a multi-page portfolio website showcasing your projects. Include navigation, responsive design, and clean UI.

readingMaterials.title: React Documentation - Main Concepts
readingMaterials.description: Official React documentation covering core concepts

readingMaterials.title: Thinking in React
readingMaterials.description: A guide to thinking about React applications

title: CS201: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Advanced data structures, algorithm analysis, and problem-solving techniques. Prerequisite: CS101.

syllabus.title: Closures and Scope
syllabus.description: Understanding lexical scope and closure patterns

title: DS101: Introduction to UI/UX Design
description: Principles of user interface and user experience design. Design thinking, user research, and prototyping methodologies.

title: CS301: Web Development and Backend Systems
description: Server-side programming with Node.js, database design, and RESTful API development. Prerequisite: CS201.

title: DS201: Data Science and Machine Learning
description: Statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization. Python-based data science workflows.

title: MD201: Mobile Application Development
description: Cross-platform mobile development using React Native. App architecture, native APIs, and deployment strategies.
